original: HANSSON, Bror Olov Nikolaus, överingenjör, Stockholm, f Bollnäs 5/1 00 av bankdir N H o Sigrid Olsson, gm Gudrun Stanler.Studex 18, KTH (eltekn) 18—^2, Komm.koll o Sv-Am.stift:s stip f studier USA 28—29. Anst Sieverts Kabelverk 24—28, Common-wealth Edison Co Chicago 28—^29, Liljeholmens Kabelfabrik sed. 29, övering där sed. 30. Inneh ett 40-tal in- o utl patent på eltekn o mek uppf. Styr.led Sv Elektroing.frn sed. 41, styr.suppl AB Liljeh Kabelfabrik sed. 43. Resor: Sydamer 27, USA 28—29 o fi resor i Europa. Av trycket: Bidr t fråg om använd av kondens f kompens av reaktiv effekt (Tekn Tidskr 27), Starkströmskondens f vxl-strömsnät (Elektrotekn Tidskr 28), Stark-strömskabelinstall i USA (Tekn Tidskr 28), Kortslutn.skydd i Chicagos kraftsystem (Tekn Tidskr 29), På Inkafolkets stigar gm Colombia (NDA 28), Elektrifierade mönstergårdar (ERA, Electra 29), Static condensers for power circuits (ASEA:s Journal 35, ASEA:s Tidn 34), Sjökablar (ASEA:s Tidn o Driftbe-styreren, Norge, 37), The dielectric strength of impregnated paper under high pressure (ASEA:s Journal 39), The foil cooled pressure capacitor (ASEA:s Tidn 39), Förbättras ej de gummiisolerade ledningarna? (ERA 40), Syntetiskt gummi (Tekn Tidskr 38), En ny kondensator (Tekn Tidskr 39), Kontinuerlig kabeltillverkning samt Isolationsmaterialens jämnhet som mått på kvaliteten (ASEA:s Tidn
translated: HANSSON, Bror Olov Nikolaus, chief engineer, Stockholm, born in Bollnäs on January 5, 1900, son of bank director N.H. and Sigrid Olsson, married to Gudrun Stanler. Studied at the age of 18, attended the Royal Institute of Technology (majoring in electrical engineering) from 1918 to 1922. Received scholarships from the Swedish-American Foundation for studies in the USA from 1928 to 1929. Employed at Sieverts Cable Works from 1924 to 1928, Commonwealth Edison Company in Chicago from 1928 to 1929, Liljeholmens Cable Factory since 1929, and has been chief engineer there since 1930. Holds approximately 40 international and domestic patents in the field of electrical engineering and mechanical inventions. Board member of the Swedish Electrical Engineers Association since 1941, and board supervisor of AB Liljeh Kabelfabrik since 1943. Traveled to South America in 1927, the USA from 1928 to 1929, and made several trips in Europe. Published works include contributions on the use of condensers for compensating reactive power (Technical Journal, 1927), high voltage condensers for alternating current networks (Electrotechnical Journal, 1928), high-voltage cable installations in the USA (Technical Journal, 1928), short-circuit protection in Chicago's power system (Technical Journal, 1929), journey through Colombia on the Inca trails (New Daily News, 1928), electrified model farms (ERA, Electra, 1929), static condensers for power circuits (ASEA's Journal, 1935; ASEA's Magazine, 1934), submarine cables (ASEA's Magazine and Manager, Norway, 1937), the dielectric strength of impregnated paper under high pressure (ASEA's Journal, 1939), the foil-cooled pressure capacitor (ASEA's Magazine, 1939), are rubber insulated cables improving? (ERA, 1940), synthetic rubber (Technical Journal, 1938), a new capacitor (Technical Journal, 1939), continuous cable production and uniformity of insulation materials as a measure of quality (ASEA's Magazine).
